info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Union County through 645 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Monroe, or 5 miles northeast of Unionville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Unionville, Fairview In Union County and New Salem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
